intro: Legousia pentagonia, commonly known as the pentagonal legousia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive pentagonal-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or riverine habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
